Reviews.Title: “King Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flashman268_10
Reviews.Content: Basic but clean and a good location, rooms are tiny and the stairs very steep but there is a lift, breakfast was as you would expect for a basic hotel. You have to pay 20 Euro deposit for your room key but it is returned and we were able to check in early with no hassle. You get what you pay for and its only a base for sleeping in, wouldnt like to stay more than 2 nights or it could become a bit cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: dan_ielle20Liverpool Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, extremely close to all of the shops and quite a few pubs, little bit away from the station but it's easy enough to walk if you know where you're going.

Reviews.Title: “value for money break”
Reviews.Author: katherine h Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: good,clean very central hotel would certainly stay here again, the room had a canal view and very comfy beds, breakfast was a bit on the sparce side. For an eye popping experience head to the red light area, the Old Sailor' is a great bar with interesting views!!!

Reviews.Title: “feels a bit dirty”
Reviews.Author: LuisSuarez7
Reviews.Content: Good location close to liedsplien but room wasn't ready when i first went in and nearly broke my neck when trying to find cleaner watch out for the stairs especially if youv'e had a smoke. Room was a bit dirty. Cheapish hotel for amsterdam but wouldnt stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for”
Reviews.Author: Pyongyangsucks
Reviews.Content: Agree with other reviews, that location is good. But my room was tiny - I took a single room and regretted. The TV is set above the bed in a position that is impossible to watch. The safety box was on the floor, again in a bad place. View from window was into other guest's room. Bed sheets and towels were old, with holes. No face towel or mat in the bathroom. Shower box was clean. A lot of noise from the corridors as people return from their night explorations but fortunately once they get in their rooms, things get silent. B'fast is served from 8AM what is a bit late if you want to start early. No fruits other than the syrupy fruit salad, no veggies like the usual sliced tomato and cucumber. Hotel ask 20Euro deposit for the keys - if you leave early ask for refund on the night before.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: lilacsugar
Reviews.Content: After a long search for a hotel in Amsterdam for my trip in March 2011, I finally settled for King Hotel/Hotel King. The location of this hotel is perfect - it is at Leidseplein, overlooking the canal, with 6 tram lines passing the nearby tram stop. The hotel is less than 10 mins away from the Amsterdam Centraal Station by tram and a short walk from the tram stop. Got a twin room facing the back of the hotel but it was okay - no problem with that as we just needed a room to sleep. The beds are comfy enough and the room clean. The toilet was a squeeze but that is to expect from most European hotel. It is clean though so I have no issues with that. One plus point about this hotel is that is has a lift! No way was I going to trudge up the narrow steep stairs with my luggage so I made it a point to search for hotel with lift at reasonable price and King Hotel fit my needs perfectly! Breakfast was okay though not much variety. Pretty basic but enough to fill you up. As I have dietary restrictions, I felt that the breakfast spread was good enough for me. Staff spoke English and were friendly and helpful too! Housekeeping kept our rooms tidy. When we arrived, our room was not ready so we asked to leave our luggage at the hotel while we grab some food nearby. Before leaving, we asked if there is a toilet in the common area and were directed to the 2nd floor to the tiniest toilet I've been in. It is like a 1-door closet, fits 1 person just nicely. This common toilet may be a tight squeeze for a plus size person though. Navigating inside the toilet was a challenge - what an experience! :) Anyway much to our relieve, our rooms were ready when we got back down to the reception so we checked-in first before heading out. For Muslims, there are a couple of Halal shops nearby so food is not a problem at all. Overall, a great stay in Amsterdam and King Hotel! I look forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, decent breakfast, canal view rooms”
Reviews.Author: idealistmind
Reviews.Content: The location is just the best , just by the canal 2 mins from Leidseplein. Rooms are big, the hotel entrance looks small but rooms are not bad at all. Breakfast in the morning was gr8 ! Staff was really really helpful. Take cash with you while paying, they charge for cards otherwise. Really good place to stay on budget right where the city comes to life

Reviews.Title: “With minor tweaks, could have been a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Chandan D
Reviews.Content: Pros: Very good buffet breakfast. Helpful and nice management. Very good location. Cons: Small rooms. A bit on the dirty side.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Linda M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night, although we had booked for four. This hotel has been upgraded from a hostel- but very poorly. It was far too expensive for what was offered and is misrepresented as chic. It was dirty, poorly run and the bathrooms were so tiny they were unusuable. The staff hardly spoke Dutch or English and they ask for cash upfront to prevent a 6% surcharge on your credit card. Stay away. There are lots of other wonderful hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Super helpful staff, small but most comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Parklee
Reviews.Content: King hotel has the sort of friendly staff you would hope to get to service you were ever you travel. Staying in hotel or airline you require attention and efficient service and help. That's exactly what you get at the King hotel. Rooms are small but very comfortable and the hotel's location is simply great next to what ever you want to do in Amsterdam. Facilities are above par for this lovely 2 star hotel. A must stay hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and convenient location but very basic for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: Invisible_Shadow
Reviews.Content: King Hotel is a very basic hotel with the bare essentials for a central stay to Leidsplein. Service was fairly friendly and the receptionist went out of her way to accommodate an early check in. Arrived at this hotel at 11am and they juggled the rooms about to let us check in at 11.45am. Usual check in time is 3pm. The room size is average while the on suite bathroom is tiny! The double room is actually made up of two single beds, which is a bit of an irritation. The bathroom did not have a bathmat and when I enquired about this, I was given a regular towel to use as a bathmat as they don't have bathmats. You have to pay a small deposit for the keys of the room, which is returned to you upon check out. I wouldn't stay here again as the hotel was too expensive for the basic amenities provided, having said that the location is good.

Reviews.Title: “For a short stay was great.”
Reviews.Author: 00karnage
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed in a hotel without an en suite so I was chuffed when we reached the King Hotel. It was in a great location, easy to find and close to Leidseplein. Room was comfortable enough but the view was terrible, could see straight into other rooms! Staff were friendly and the breakfast was sufficient. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel - had loads of fun”
Reviews.Author: Mayfairlondon1010
Reviews.Content: Just visited Amsterdam with a few friends, all same age couples. King hotel was superb for the value and the service we received. Staff was exception with their efficient service, made our stay most wonderful. We all will be back soon to enjoy more of the same fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jenmcc83
Reviews.Content: Im just back from staying at this hotel. I am so glad i wasn't put off by some of the rubbish reviews on here. It is a fantastic hotel ok rooms were small but it is Amsterdam and all houses are small. Very clean, beds changed everyday and fresh towels left. Very good location just off ledseplein square. Room 11 we stayed in, very quiet room on 3rd floor. Staff were friendly, let us check-in 3 hrs early. We were also able to leave our luggage in the hotel on the last day until we left for the airport for 3 euros. Very good hotel, would recommend and its cheaper compared to most.

Reviews.Title: “Too old and small”
Reviews.Author: andrea-n-q
Reviews.Content: I reaaly tould like to advise: the hotel is very old, and the bedrooms are too small. thw bathromm was the smallest iÂ´ve never seen! Staf unfriendly It changed every day. Breakfast ok. Excellet location. Only this.

Reviews.Title: “Must stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: JaanBeek
Reviews.Content: Have just been travelling all over Europe on business with my colleagues and one hotel just sticks out in our memory for the best place to stay in our European trip and that is the King Hotel in Amsterdam. All of us who stayed had a good time and a very comfortable and effecient stay as the hotel has a good location but on top of that the most efficient staff. We all can write a very long review but want to mainly say that this hotel King was the best of the 5 cities we visited during our recent trip. We all have deceided to put this hotel in our company recomendations and I will try to book this for personal visit to Amsterdam as well.

Reviews.Title: “Only the location is good...the rest is terrible”
Reviews.Author: bortosrobert
Reviews.Content: If you are staying more than 3 nights in Amsterdam than you better choose another hotel. We stayed for 2 weeks but we regret that we stayed at this hotel. We cannot say nothing good about the service and the confort. The room was very small and dirty. The matressses were too soft and two for a double bed. They changed the bed sheets only after we discussed with the receptionist, after more than a week. The bathroom was incredibble tiny. The breakfast was insupportable, no vegetables, no fruits. After 2 days we had to buy some vegetables because the food was very dry. Can you imagine eating for two weeks the same food? 2 types of cheese and 3 types of ham, boiled eggs, milk and mussli and 2 types of juice, that's all. The internet was not working on my mobile phone, altough it was free. I m really sorry that we stayed in this hotel. I travelled a lot in this world, from Kasachstan to Switzerland, but i never payed key deposit like i did at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Excitment”
Reviews.Author: Roydel
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Amsterdam, one of the most exciting cities and our favourite as well. Our stay at King Hotel made it even more to like Amsterdam. King is a very well located, fine, small boutique hotel next to the famous Leidseplein and the museums. The staff was most helpful as they went out of their way to make our stay most wonderful. We enjoyed the day after a good breakfast to visit the museums which were close by. In the afternoon & evenings we strolled to the Vondelpark and stopped at the Casino. The nights are always full of fun in Amsterdam specially when you stay at King which is next to the happening center of Amsterdam. Thank you King for lovely stay. We sure will be back soon, maybe this summer itself.

Reviews.Title: “basic but exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: anonymous186337
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quiet, the rooms basic, breakfast good, staff excellent and the location fabulous. The only concern was the thinness of the walls but that was a small price to pay for this hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: kemfree
Reviews.Content: Excellent location being just off the Leidseplein where the bars and restaurants are and easy to get to all the sights. (Beware the â€˜Irishâ€™ bars on the Leidseplein where you are paying extra for mediocre food & service. For a Sports Bar and food the Pancake House is better value.) Booked a â€œSuperiorâ€� double room which I can only assume that â€œsuperiorâ€� means it has en-suite facilities and a canal view. The bathroom was clean and modern but the room looked grubby and very tired. The double room was two singles pushed together and the mattresses were very soft, uncomfortable and need replacing. The impressive ceiling cornice work looked original but hadnâ€™t been made into a feature and could do with a coat of emulsion. Avoid room 5 as it is immediately above the entrance (smokers corner at all hours -noisy) and has an illuminated sign that is on 24 hours â€“ very bright because of thin curtains. There is a small lift which is required if you are above the first floor as the stairs (in common with all old Dutch houses) are very narrow and nearly vertical! The staff are very friendly and most helpful with their advice and recommendations. The continental breakfast offered a good variety and was plentiful. Tips:- the little advertising cards in a rack opposite the lift are useful for discounts especially the Canal Bus 24hr ticket which we used to travel all four routes to see the sights and museums. Unlike London where the permanent exhibitions at the main Galleries and Museums are free, Amsterdam Museums and Galleries charge a hefty amount for Adults which can make it a deterrent and I found it far more expensive than any previous visit and about 50% more expensive than Barcelona or Paris. Cash deposit of â‚¬20 required for Room & Hotel key and a 6% handling fee for Credit Cards and even for Debit Cards! I prepaid and booked via Venere.com and got charged the extra 6% but was told by the hotel that it didnâ€™t apply to reservations via Booking.com! I am still awaiting an acknowledgement to my email about this from Customer Service at Venere!

Reviews.Title: “good for short term !”
Reviews.Author: CutegirlMorocco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally located, near tramway station. The room and the bathroom we had were small but clean, tough we the carpet was stained... The breakfast was okay, nothing special. The computer at the reception was not working well...i payed 5 euros for nothing. i had to go to the cyber cafÃ© in front of the train station : Amsterdam centraal. i would recommend this hotel for a short stay period...not for long term holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: dippydennis
Reviews.Content: Cheap basic hotel in area that provides easy access to most other areas of city. I was happy with it for the price but my wife was not at all impressed but this is my review. Breakfast reasonable and plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “The King and I!!”
Reviews.Author: lucylucy86
Reviews.Content: When arriving at this hotel our party were able to check in earlier than the check in time! Please note that you have to pay 20 euro for the room cards when you check in which you do get back at the end of your stay! The hotel room was clean and tidy and so was the rest of the hotel, in the actual room there was limited space to put clothes however, this was not so much of a problem when staying for only a few days! The breakfast starts at 8 till half 9 and was pretty poor when we arrived the tables had not been cleared even though making it down at 08:45. The only advantage of such a poor breakfast is there is so much choice to eat out in amsterdam and would of missed out by eating at the hotel. The hotel also changed our towels in the bathroom in our room everyday and also changed our sheets once whilst we were there which was not expected at all but was a nice touch from a basic hotel! The hotel is in a fab location near bars and restaurants and just near the canal cruise stop and tram lines! The hotel is also near the tourist office to get tram travel cards! On our last day we were able to to store our luggage at the hotel for 3 euro a piece and we decided to get a taxi to the airport booked by the hotel which for 4 people worked out about the same as tram and train\fair back! All in all our trip to amsterdam was fantastic and we have no complaints about the hotel as somewhere to rest your head for the night which was clean and tidy!

Reviews.Title: “great location and not a bad little hotel !”
Reviews.Author: barryhanson
Reviews.Content: me and my gf went last week and after busy travel from station to hotel were welcomed with being able to check in four hours before the stated check in which helped alot.our room (21) was up in the attic and was a nice size and clean throughout,althou not much storage to hang clothes it did the job nicely,the breakfasts werent amazing and we headed out to find our own most mornings, overall the hotel was clean and the staff were helpful and polite, would stay again without a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoSilva
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at King Hotel on a Weekend Break with my partner and I had a great time. The Staff on the reception was very helpful, we've choosed to be in a Canal View room that was a small room, but confortable. we've could reach all major attractions within walk distance. There is a people that always saying few things about hotel staying, but each of us had a diferent experience. Love the place, and rather be back soon! Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “Functional . The female receptionist rude and supercilious”
Reviews.Author: johne10Peterborough
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers said, the stairs to the room were near vertical, and extremely dangerous. The actual owner was nice, but the female receptionist that served me in the July of 2005 made no effort to greet tired tourists: she had her hand out ready for the money, without one word of friendliness. Speaking simple phrases of holiday Flemish met with arrogant disinterest. I would be inclined, in hindsight, to have given her a piece of my mind, but that is a lesson learnt by a naive traveller. Food however, was nice, and there was plenty of diversity and interest in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Basic value for money”
Reviews.Author: raaadek1
Reviews.Content: Not a great hotel but for Â£50 a night for a double with breakfast you surely can not expect more in Amsterdam. Good location, 20 min walking from Centraal Station. Nearby Leidesplain is a lively square with lots of bars and coffee shops. Clean, small room with tiny bathroom fitted with shower. can not comment on breakfast quality as it is available between 8-9:30am only, which was much too early for us (I think they actually do it on purpose so not too many guests will make it). All in all you get what you pay for, looking for a bed in a clean room with a reasonable location then go for it. Looking to be pampered - look elswhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value 2 Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HampshireSeasider
Reviews.Content: The King Hotel is on the Leidsekade which is in the Leidseplein area. From the airport get the train to the Central Station and a 1,2 or 5 tram down to the Leidseplein, an easy journey which will be much less than 10e. We chose a room (number 15!) which overlooks the canal and has french doors that open onto a very small balcony. South facing and lovely and sunny when we were there. Clean and tidy, good bathroom (shower) and continental breakfast (cereals, bread/toast usual meat/cheese/jams etc) The staff are very friendly and helpful,particularly the owner's daughter! Very steep stairs which I did not attempt to use, so the lift was a godsend. I have read other reviews of this hotel and was nearly put off booking so have uploaded my thoughts for a more balanced view. We were caught up in the air traffic chaos of the Icelandic Volcano and were able to return to this hotel for another night in the same room at the same rate, which was good. On the second day of disruption we had to move to their sister hotel The Atlas a supposedly 3* but nowhere near as good (see separate report!) and 50% more!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel with GREAT location”
Reviews.Author: k3vpa
Reviews.Content: As far as horels go, this is your basic B&B, excellent value, nice and tidy small rooms with comfortable beds, and a very tasty traditional Dutch breakfast, This hotels is located perfectly and is within a 15 minute walk of everywhere you would need to go from Ann Frankhouse to Madam Tousaudes and the main Dam square. Really enjoyed the stay here and the staff were fantastic and helpful. would big this place up to anyone that was to ask me.

Reviews.Title: “Full of Fun, Comfort & Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Leelajyoti
Reviews.Content: We found the staff at King Hotel very friendly and most helpful. Always there with a pleasant smile and efficient. I was there with my family and had two rooms, both roomsre we got were of very high standard and made our stay most pleasant and comfortable. What we paid was a fraction of similar hotels in Amsterdam with the type of rooms we got. I would not hesitate to definately recommend this hotel to all. I can't understand some of the reviews posted by others for this very nive King Hotel in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paulgavin
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed in The King hotel, Amsterdam from the 18th Aug until 21st Aug of this year. As most people do, we arrived at Centraal Station from the airport and decided that we would try and find the hotel on foot. To say the least this wasn't as easy as it was initially anticipated. If you are planning to stay in this hotel I would advise that you do some research as to the exact location of the hotel before you leave. We didn't do this as I had been in Amsterdam twice before and had a rough idea of getting around so all we had was a printed off google map. Its roughly a 25 minute walk from Centraal Station. On arrival to the hotel, check-in went smoothly and the staff were friendly enough. Word of warning, look out for the ladder-like stairs in the hotel, i'm sure there has been many an accident on them! Like alot of Amsterdam hotels, King Hotel is small and basic. That was fine as it was all we required. As long as it was clean, which it was, then we didn't mind! The breakfast in the hotel was a basic continental breakfast but not bad at allHowever, there were two bad points about this hotel. The first being the water! The water that came from the shower had a terrible odour omitting from it. It was pure stagnant. Not nice at all. The second bad point wasn't really the fault of the hotel but there was a site that was undergoing constant construction at the back of the hotel. This started at approximately 7.30am every morning so you can forget about getting any sleep after this hour! The best point about the hotel was its location. It was situated in a lovely area full of nice restaurants and art galleries and without the intimidation of dodgy people that you might get in other parts of the city. It is about a 20 minute walk from the red light district so you can have the best of both worlds, the calm relaxed side and the wild mental side only a walk away! If the hotel sorted out their water, then i would definately recommend it to everyone as the basic package, nothing luxurious about it at all.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frontrunner1
Reviews.Content: Donâ€™t stay here, its dirty, smelly and very unfriendly. The rooms are very very small, you have to stand on the bed so you can open the wardrobe. We had to go to the pharmacy to get bug cream we had so many bug bites. Its not very clean , the bed covers had cigarette holes in them even though this is a non smoking hotel !! only ever hotel in the area was fully booked we would not have stayed. will never go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mice in this hotel, dont stay there!!”
Reviews.Author: acruzalegui
Reviews.Content: The hotel customer service was alright, I was happy to overlook it since the location was good. The room itself was fine, the sinks are a bit badly placed and you can barely put your face near it. All was ok except for when my friend and I had to assist the front desk girl in trying to get the jammed elevator doors open as there was a mouse stuck in it!! When this was brought to the hotel manager/owners attention she refused to do anything about it and denied my request for a refund. I would NEVER stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Budget basic hotel in center of Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: washbrol
Reviews.Content: Hotel: Along an untrafficked bend of one of Amsterdam's canals, King's Hotel is a simple budget hotel that I stopped into without reservation one Friday night due to a change in plan. A narrow canal house, steep steps wind up each floor. An elevator exists also. No lobby, only a small reception desk. Budget and basic. Rooms: Mid-sized for Europe. Basic furnishings. Everything somewhat worn, including bed linens. Location: Along an untrafficked bend of one of Amsterdam's canals, in city center.

Reviews.Title: “What a horrible smell!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chutneygirl
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend in Amsterdam for a Christmas present for my husband. The travel agent recommend this one for the location. I was slightly worried about the 3 star rating but as it had been recommended then thought it would be ok. When we arrived the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was room 2 and I could not believe how small the room was. There was a horrible smell in and around the hotel and could smell it in the room. It overlooked a very noisy building site. The room was the smallest room I have ever seen. It consisted of one wardrobe and that was it. No bed side cabinets. Socket on wall hanging off. The bathroom was very small but did appear clean.There was a desk in the corner for those wishing to use laptops although I think this space could have been used for more storage for travellers. The bed was supposed to be a double but was a very small double. The only plus point was the location. I was very disappointed as the pictures online made the rooms look much better and bigger. We only actually stayed in the room for about 20mins as we went in search of another hotel and found one that had rooms as we did not wish to stay there for the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “cheap cheerful clean”
Reviews.Author: WetherbyRhino
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was cheap and near the Leidesplein. It was exactly what I expected i.e no frills at all but the room was very clean and tidy. The weather was snowy and very cold but our room was lovely and warm to come back to. I also liked the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in the King Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Djbsom
Reviews.Content: On the weekend of 5th to 9th September 2008 I stayed at the King Hotel in Leidesplein Amsterdam along with my partner, my son and his young (17) girlfriend. We were pleasantly surprised by the location, comfort, value and cleanliness of the hotel. Located on a canal and very near nightlife, tram routes, boat excursion stops, good eateries and bars, it was an ideal base for our long weekend. However, the reason I felt the need to review this hotel is the way the hotel staff, owners and local police officers reacted when our weekend turned bad. For still unexplained reasons the young girl with us suffered a serious reaction to either alcohol or accidentally inhaled substances. No-one in our party knowingly took anything other than lager the whole weekend. Despite this, she became extremely violent and vocal in the early hours of Sunday morning. When my son and I could no longer contain the situation the hotel staff came to my aid and called the emergency services. A team consisting of police officers and paramedics arrived astonishingly quickly and (at my request) took her to a nearby police station for a physical examination and to try and calm her down. At this point I would have quite understood the hotel asking us to leave bearing in mind the huge disruption the episode caused to the other hotel guests. I would also have understood the police presenting us with a bill for the doctors and officers who attended to her overnight. Suffice it to say I am very impressed with the care and attention we received from everyone involved during a very difficult night many miles from home. If you are in Amsterdam - you should stay at the King Hotel. It's that simple.

Reviews.Title: “It all added to the experience..”
Reviews.Author: WIZZY3
Reviews.Content: I went in april with my friend for our 18th. It was booked on the cheap really, so I wasnt expecting luxury. The only thing to point out was the absolutely awful smell which took your breath as soon as you walked in. It smelt like rotten eggs, but the lucky thing was the stink didnt reach our room. However, it did make us not trust the food, so even though we paid for breakfast, we never went for it. Also.. those stairs are a deathtrap.. and the lift seemed unsafe to take at the same time. Despite all this, the staff were friendly and kindly let us keep our luggage behind the reception as we were too early to go to our room. The room were clean, and cleaned daily. And, we hardly stayed in anyway, only too sleep.. so the fact the hotel wasn't luxurious, it wasnt a big deal. I wouldnt change going there, as it was a funny experience.

Reviews.Title: “Take notice of the reviews !! we did'nt”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolScoobydoo
Reviews.Content: As within my title, make sure that you are paying attention to the reviews from this website!!. We booked this hotel through a travel agent before checking out the reviews. When you look at the actual hotel website www.hotel-king.nl you will not be expecting the lovelly bright rooms that it advertised, I am sure that the room on the website it actually the hotel managers room!. As within all reviews on this website, the hotel is hard to find but that sort of adds to the experience! (I think...). When you finaly arrive we just laughed as it looks like sheltered accomodation for the homeless, we pressed the rather impressive buzzer on the door and then we entered! my god what the fook is that smell...seriously to me it was sewage and believe me you do not get used to it. We booked 2 rooms from Superbreaks and when we arrived they advised that they only have 1 room, so please confirm your booking before you leave, to cut a bad experience short they did give us the other room. You have to pay â‚¬20 deposit for your room keys which is refundable. The rooms were very basic but I must add that the smell is NOT in the rooms... the rooms are very small but they are clean. The best thinng about the hotel is the shower!, we did not attempt to eat in the hotel so i can not comment on the food. The lift goes off at roughly 7pm and you are then tasked to climb the very steep stairs, and belive me they are extremelly steep but this is quite normal for Amsterdam. All in all we would never stay there again but we had such fun coming back pissed and climbing to our rooms. This hotel is a fair distance from the central Dam square but you can jump on a tram for â‚¬1.60..... local area is very very expensive so try and drink of the tram tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: KilleKalla
Reviews.Content: We love Amsterdam and tried a new hotel, the King Hotel. We booked it through hotels.nl. When we wanted to chek in, the manager told us that they charged a surcharge of 30â‚¬ if we paid with a credit card. We didn't have the amount in cash so we told them that according to our written contract (print out from the webpage) there was no surcharge. The manger and the owner (via the phone) were extremly unfriendly. In the end they told us that they would reimburse us the money (145â‚¬, whcih was the downpayment). We are still waiting for this reimbursement. We didn't stay at this hotel and found another one nearby. We do not recommend this hotel at all

Reviews.Title: “April 2008”
Reviews.Author: Rojcrad
Reviews.Content: The first thing to greet you as you walk through the front door is the stench. I lift wasn't always working and the stairs are VERY steep. Our room was almost too small for the two beds, the bathroom is tiny - handbasin too small and tap too big so the best way to have a wash was in the shower. Brilliant shower by the way. Breakfast room didn't appear to have enough seating if all the rooms were occupied, and every time anyone came through the door the stench came too. Also the staff didn't seem in too much of a hurry to replenish the breakfast items. All in all NOT one I'd recommend - unless your a backpacker on a limited budget.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my god the smell!”
Reviews.Author: tracetheface
Reviews.Content: Impossible to find unless you knew where it was. Asked for tea and coffee in the rooms which they kept forgetting and then sending up kettles which sparked every time you plugged them in! Bedside light fell off every time you tried to to switch it on and the window was jammed, so thanks for the free sex show next door (NOT) and it was freezing! Receptionist couldn't even tell us how to get the zoo and the smell was just disgusting. We did tell them but they didn't seem to notice it but on our last day they put Joss sticks up in reception. Nice try but no way! Lovely location tho, just try another hotel! Americain looks fab!

Reviews.Title: “couldn't swing a cat”
Reviews.Author: mirekblack
Reviews.Content: arrived at the hotel on 29 december and stayed til the 3rd of january 08. Definately not a place to stay if you like comfort it was extremely small and poky and for the price we paid really expected a bit more. There was a terrible smell in the hotel like they had a problem with the drains or something. Breakfast was only served between 8 and 9.30 and was really not worth getting up for. Stairs were very steep and narrow thank god they had an elevator! Bathroom also was very small but clean and had a nice power shower. Really the best thing about this hotel is its location everything else leaves a lot to be desired. However even the poor hotel could not take away from the experience that is Amsterdam..

Reviews.Title: “My Stay At The King Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tartanladno1
Reviews.Content: " I booked this Hotel in March for a week I went from Scotland and found this Hotel ok. One thing that spoiled it was the Guy i went with snored all night.( Noisy begger) The one thing that springs to mind is the stairs in the hotel are very steep so beware anyone that has any difficulty with stairs, so you would be better to ask for bottom floor when you are booking, apart from the stair's all was ok. The room was basic but ok with t v in room, but no remote, Heaters were in the room ,which is handy as Holland in March can be cold ( take note ) shower rm was alright and spacious which was just outside the main room door, also toilet was not far at end of the hall. Breakfast was basic, Id much rather a British style cooked breakfast but i knew in advance. After a look around the city i found a restaurant called the Londoner it was ok with good old fashioned Fish n' chips and a pint Hieneken which was free with meal ( jist cannae beat that like's ) Oh and last but not least if you have bags/ belongings then look after them as Holland is rife with sticky fingers, if u leave behind you wont get them back. Stevie Burrell Dunfermline, Fife.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular but pleasant”
Reviews.Author: muppySG
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights, 28 and 29 Sept. The single room was tiny! And the walls were so thin I kept getting woken up by neighbours opening their doors. Breakfast spread was limited. Location was OK but I wouldn't have been able to find it if I hadn't called the hotel. Take tram 1, 2 or 5 from Centraal Station ($1.60euros) and stop at Leidseplein (about a 10 minute ride). There is an opera house of sorts. Walk past it and you'll see "Cafe Americain". That's the American Hotel. King Hotel is about 2 minutes away on the same block. There is a very good row of restaurants nearby, just opposite where the pub area is. I had fantastic Greek and Italian dinners. Good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Same hotel? It must have improved”
Reviews.Author: BlueBay100
Reviews.Content: We found our way to the King Hotel by way of the hotel call board in the airport. Reading the reviews after the fact it doesn't sound like the same place. In Leidesplein, on the canal, right? It was absolutely fine for 100 euro a night. The room was small but clean, comfortable double bed with nice duvet, nice flat screen TV with remote, a/c, hair dryer, and an excellent shower. The sink is amusingly tiny and you have to make sure you don't bang your head on the faucet or the shelf but they did a lot in a tiny space. Our bathroom was all IN the room, not down a hallway. If it helps, we were in room 27, on the top floor, which always made going up and down the steep stairs a fun challenge too. Breakfast provided coffee, tea, juice, various cereals, breads, coldcuts, soft boiled eggs, and fruit cocktail. Adequate for "included". It appeared to have in-room internet hook-up too but I never bring a laptop when I'm concentrating on having fun! The location was excellent. Quietly tucked around the corner from a great happening area. We got the last room available so maybe there were lesser rooms we weren't even aware of. We asked to see it before signing on the dotted line, which is always a good idea. The "hotel full" sign went up after we checked in so we were doubly pleased we didn't have to go door knocking to find another room.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Adcraig
Reviews.Content: After eventually finding my booking reservation (and i wish they hadn't) I spent 3 days in this place. I had a 'luxery' room which contained a sink- unfortunately i couldn't wash or dare drink the water due to the oil smell and consistency of the water. One to avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: gburtonio
Reviews.Content: Rooms here a pretty small, clean but a bit grubby, and overpriced. Forget getting a room that remotely resembles the ones they show on the website. Toilets and showers are in the corridors and are absolutely tiny. We paid â‚¬75 a night here for a double (well actually a twin, and one of the beds had a broken leg which I had to try to screw back on to stop the bed falling over) and it wasn't good value - you even have to pay to leave your luggage after checkout, when every hotel I have ever been to has allowed that for free. It's a good location and seems pretty secure, but I'm sure there must be better deals out there.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: 63conrad
Reviews.Content: First things first, this is not a hotel, it is a youth hostel. As youth hostels go, it was clean, secure, relatively quiet (except for the slamming doors) nicely located, and expensive. By hotel standards, the room was small, the beds uncomfortable, bathrooms were accessible but "down the hall," the remoteless TV didn't work well, no air-conditioning, no non-smoking rooms, and the breakfast was mediocre at best. In short, it's a hotel for single travelers, not families of any variety. Don't be fooled.

Reviews.Title: “Walk in closet”
Reviews.Author: philpr
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay in single 'room' number 21 at the cost of 165 euros plus tax. I have stayed in a variety of hotels ranging from 5* to shared hostel accomodation. I understand the difference between hostel, budget, luxury etc. This was, in complete honesty, the worst, least value for money place I have ever experienced. I think 'room' 21 has been created by erecting a very thin partion in room 20 (most likely was previously the the walk -in wardrobe of this room) The photos of rooms on the website are completely alien to me. You will find, on arrival, that there is no left luggage facility, unless you want to pay 1 euro per hour, no tea or coffee making facility, unless you want to pay 15/16 euros for your 'entire' stay, no tv remote, unless you want to pay a 5 euro deposit, no key, unless you want to pay a 20 euro deposit..... shall I continue? I couldn't wait to get out of this most depressing place, unfortunately it has clouded my view of Amsterdam, I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “convenient and cheap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about booking a budget hotel but need not have worried. The hotel was in a great position within walking distance of the main museums and our room though tiny overlooked the canal. Our room was on the third floor and as the stairs were very steep it might be a problem for some. The staff were really helpful at all times, at breakfast if some foods weren't left they brought more as soon as it was noticed or mentioned. This is a budget hotel so don't expect five star accomodation or service but for the price it's a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in King Hotel as a young couple just a week ago. As we arrived in Amsterdam without having booked a hotel, we were quite concerned if it would be posible to find a cheap and still nice hotel. we were lucky enough to find King Hotel by chance. As we entered the hotel, we were greeted by a friendly staff, and offered to take a look at the room before renting it as we weren't quite sure about the sharing toilet/bathroom thing. But when we saw the room (#4) we were really sure that it really is the place!! The room was nice and clean, it had a double bed and a single bed, a sink and towels in the room, plenty of space and a beautiful view of the canal. Besides, it is so close to the center, and Leidseplein is just behind the corner. Ask any Dutch person to confirm, that it is the place for nightlife!! The receptionist gave us all the info we wanted about the places to dine and go out and was in general very helpful. The steps are steep, thats true, but we didn't here any noises from inside or outside the hotel. Probably we were just lucky. I believe it is a great value for money, but if you expect a uniformed staff, bathtub and someone to take care of your luggage - don't go there!!

Reviews.Title: “King of Kings”
Reviews.Author: BackpackingBabe
Reviews.Content: Have to admit I was wary when my friend told me she'd booked our accomodation at a 1* budget hotel, being a fairly well-travelled, luxury-loving holiday snob. That said, I had no reason to worry. We were met by friendly staff, pleasant and clean surroundings, a cosy room and a great breakfast spread each morning. The shared bathroom facilities were maintained well and, in general, this was great value for money! My only problem with the King Hotel were the staircases - very very steep!! If you can face those, though, this is place is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best :-(”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very friendly welcome but you definitely get what you pay for here ie a (-)budget hotel. Having visited Amsterdam several times now & tried a few hotels ranging from 3*-5* this was I am afraid to say the most disappointing hotel yet. We were looking for a cheap/long-weekend break in October so booked a double room here. Don't be fooled by the web pics of the rooms here. Thankfully we were only staying 3 nights & were too busy out enjoying ourselves all day & late into the night to be bothered ruining our holiday by complaining. The "double???" room we booked looked onto a nice courtyard. It resembled living in a cupboard. It would have been totally unbearable for a couple to live in this room for more than a weekend. If booked for a week we would have left! On opening the door...the double head-boardless bed was squashed hard up against the wall on one side & of course the door opened at the other side. Obviously this meant there was no room for bedside cabinets. There was no chest of drawers or storage in the room apart from a "single" MDF hanging wardrobe with only enough room to hang a couples jackets :-( & it had one small top shelf. This was between 2 adults on holiday! Obviously we had to keep all our clothes/underwear in our suitcases which we'd to constantly trip over to reach the sink as there was nothing big enough to put our suitcases on either. On going down to breakfast 1st morning, we were met with one available table which we could only describe as being left like a pig-sty by the previous people (not the hotel staff's fault). We sat perched on the end of the chairs & waited patiently for 15 mins before getting fed up waiting for someone to clear it so we moved to the next available table which was left cleaner. We'd then to ask the waitress for knifes and glasses, she'd to go and wash some as none were available. Also had to ask her to stock up on the self-service supplies ie milk and juice. Totally unorganised place. Heard others complaining about the bread & edges of cheese being hard. True. Similar problems the 2nd morning but thankfully the 3rd morning seemed far more organised, an older lady was on duty, with the young "pleasant" receptionist. 1 waitress seemed to be manning the reception at the same time as cleaning tables & loading the dishwasher. She seemed pleasant but the other young waitress on duty the 1st couple of days seemed totally fed up, dour and disinterested Our bedroom room was on the 1st floor & directly above the dining room. Therefore from early hours we were subjected to the constant noise of the heavy wooden chairs grinding off the ceramic tiles as people got up & down. As this room was situated on the 1st floor you also get the constant noise of everyone walking up & down the stairs, slamming the shared toilet & shower doors etc. It was unbearable. The noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in. Shower & toilet facilities were clean though. Thankfully as we were out at night until all hours so we missed the night noise that others have mentioned. probably as we were always last in at night ;-) (couldn't bear to be in that room haha). Ideal hotel for students, or just a place to put your head down. I certainly would not recommend it for couples and we certainly wouldn't return again. Rooms are clean but it's disgraceful advertising it as a double & charging double rates. A total rip off. Amsterdam is wonderful place, great fun & more than made up for the disappointing, substandard hotel. Try Grasshoppers Bar, fab place.

Reviews.Title: “Good stuff!!”
Reviews.Author: Mrwurzal
Reviews.Content: The story begins...... Friday 25th November me and 4 of my mates gets to the airport and jumps into an 8 seater (cost 35 Euro's) Direct to King Hotel. After having a delayed flight and not ariving to the hotel until 10pm our main aim was to get into the room and get straight out on the rown! We arrived at the hotel to a friendly welcome and booked in no problems at all all the staff very friendly! We then started the scary treck up the VERY STEEP STAIRS!! WARNING DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU HAVE CHILDREN OR IF YOU ARE NOT STEADY ON YOUR FEET! The stairs are very steep but as they are in all the Buildings in that particular area. The room. The rooms we were in was a twin and a triple ( i was in the triple) The room itself was not the Fantastic but what it was was a clean basic room with comfortable beds!! All we needed perfect for a 2 day stay! The shower room was good, clean and served the purpose, The breakfast was a typical COntinental style of a good standard (after we all drank them out of Orange Juice, Rehydration!! On the whole this is a very good hotel perfect locastion and very cheap! This isnt a classy hotel but really is PERFECT for a lads weekend and not really suited for families etc.... Its worth a look here!! A1!! Thanks...

Reviews.Title: “Not keen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the King Hotel last week. The room itself was very small, had a view of another hotel room opposite and not unlike a cell. I am used to basic accomodation, however this was a step too far as far as I am concerned. Granted the room was cheap relative to some of the other accomodation in Amsterdam, however the whole experience left me feeling a little ripped off (something that was compounded by the endless list of charges for such 'luxury' items such as a remote for the TV!) The location was good however as long as you don't mind a 15 minute walk to the center.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: King Hotel was our first hotel in a two week tour of Europe. It was a very nice budget hotel. We had a great view of a canal. The workers were friendly and helpful. They had all sorts of info available. It is on a quiet street, but there is a lot of noise from traffic on the other side of the canal. The only problems was that the stairs were steep and narrow and other people in the hotel were a little loud. But it is Amsterdam, and one should almost expect both. I could have asked the loud Germans to be quiet!

Reviews.Title: “The Best for a Budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the 2 reviews of this hotel, I thought I would write and add my opinion. After all, we need to have unbiased reviews to guide us on our travels. As an exchange teacher, I wanted a hotel which was central and cheap for my 2 weeks off in early April. The King Hotel suited me fine. I had room #4, which was one step above street level and facing the canal. (You can see a picture of it on their website) It was a great room for a wonderful price. The tour boats drifted by, and the room had an exquisite ceiling with lots of Rococo work, and a fireplace which had a ledge to hold all of your souveniers. One double and one single bed. However, if you mind the late night screamer, this is not your room. You hear everything from the street. BUT, it is a quiet street. Rather unbelievable as it is just around the corner from the Liedesplein. Okay, so there a few rowdy Brits at 2PM, so what? It adds to the atmosphere. What I liked about the King Hotel was the security. It is an "in and out" hotel, if you know what I mean. I heard one poor soul trip on the steps at 3AM. However, they replace the plastic-holed computer room keys frequently, and you need a special key to get into the hotel and into your room. The stairs are steep. (But not to Room #4 which is only one flight of stairs) Breakfast can get monotonous after a few days...the good thing is they have boiled eggs (hot and hard) every morning. It appears to be run by Oriental people who are multi-lingual..quiet, polite and efficient. Received towels everyday, and sheets were changed when requested. If you're looking for the Ritz, this is not your hotel. However, I really liked it because it was good value for money and close to everything. The tram is around the corner...Boom Chicago and the Bulldog is a 4 minute walk around the corner. To find out where it is on the map, it is directly behind the American Hotel, which has excellent pea soup. I think people need to keep an open mind in Amsterdam...this hotel is one of those little canal establishments which is a delightful secret..'round the corner from the big boys, yet still scenic and pleasant. Yes, there are a few lager louts, but they come in late and don't make it to the 8-9:30 breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “king hotel”
Reviews.Author: manuelgat
Reviews.Content: We are a young italian etero couple, king hotel did offer us a special rate then brought the price back to the origin and i had to call them back a dozen times to take evrything back to pacts, they put us in a really tiny room which was half space compared to all the other rooms in the hotel and the window was broken so we couldn't open it then the last three days even the heater broke, the worst fact is that a group of idiot german drunken guys did scream all night long for 3 nights and nobody told anything. I won't say this hotel is a ---, anyway they should care a little more about couples and give equal rooms to everyone, the price isn't lower than the service.

HotelInfo.Name: King Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Leidsekade 85-86 | Grachtengordel, Amsterdam 1017 PN, The Netherlands
